channel.title: Any experienced overclockers?
channel.description: I'm looking for someone who's done it a few times and can answer some simple questions for me, thanks! Skype: Matt Puffyball

item.title: Any experienced overclockers?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

You should have no problem hitting 5Ghz with an 8350, like 80% of the chips can hit 5Ghz. It all depends on the chip you get, the one you buy might not be able to overclock by 100mhz but realistically you shouldn’t have a problem. The 9590 is basically an overclocked 8350 (it uses better sillicon and that’s the only difference I know of personally apart from the higher clock speed).
If you can afford a custom loop then go for a better CPU. Overclocking is great but usually buying a higher tier product is more worthwhile. In most cases there’s very little reason to go custom WC. If you do decide to go custom loop lemme know, I made my own so I should be able to help you out within reason.
Btw, you can’t compare Intel & AMD stats. You should only compare benchmark results.

Read full topic

item.title: Any experienced overclockers?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Intel is generally more expensive but more efficient. AMD is cheaper and better to overclock. AMD if you’re on a budget. I always used AMD.

Read full topic

item.title: Any experienced overclockers?
item.dc:creator: @rmark45matsu rmark45matsu
item.description:
@rmark45matsu wrote:

So I was looking into the amd fx 9590, and then I read that it’s just an fx 8350 that’s stock over clocked. With basic overclocking knowledge I was looking into cooling options, I selected the h100i cooler. With more reading I found out that this might not be enough and I might need to make a custom cooling loop? I want to achieve 5 gH just like the fx 9590. I’ve read plenty of people have done it, and my power supply is 1050w.

Read full topic
